title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A young girl grows up in the racially charged South, witnessing injustice and moral courage.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates love, pride, and class in 19th-century England.

author: George Orwell
description: A totalitarian regime controls every aspect of life through surveillance and propaganda.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: A group of farm animals overthrow their human owner only to face a new tyranny.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A mysterious millionaire pursues love and the American Dream during the Jazz Age.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Captain Ahab obsessively hunts the white whale that cost him his leg.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic society conditioned by pleasure and control faces a moral crisis.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: An orphaned girl overcomes hardship to find love and independence.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A dark and passionate love story set on the windswept Yorkshire moors.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A scientist creates life and faces the consequences of playing God.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: The story of the infamous vampire who travels to England to spread his curse.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield reflects on teenage angst and alienation in New York City.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: In a world where books are banned, firemen burn them to suppress knowledge.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A humble hobbit embarks on an epic adventure to reclaim a stolen treasure.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fellowship sets out to destroy a powerful ring that threatens the world.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd seeks his destiny and learns about dreams, fate, and self-discovery.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A young man commits a crime and wrestles with guilt and redemption.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: Russian families navigate love and loss during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: An ex-convict seeks redemption amid social and political turmoil in France.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A man remains youthful while his portrait ages, reflecting his moral decay.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: A nobleman imagines himself a knight and sets out on comic adventures.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: An aging fisherman battles a giant marlin far out at sea.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A poor family migrates westward during the Great Depression.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The Buendía family saga unfolds in the mythical town of Macondo.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A man confronts his past in Afghanistan and seeks redemption for his childhood mistakes.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
description: Love and sacrifice during the French Revolution in London and Paris.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: Children discover a magical world ruled by good and evil forces.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A symbologist uncovers secrets of the Holy Grail hidden in famous artworks.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A boy survives a shipwreck and shares a lifeboat with a tiger.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A writer becomes the winter caretaker of a haunted hotel, descending into madness.
